lines.text: ...Hm. That’s weird.
What is?
This book… it looks like it’s describing some kind of demonic ritual.
This one’s pretty complicated, though… I’ll just flip through it.
W-wait!
Huh?
What is it?
You can’t turn those pages! They’re- that’s disturbing the crime scene!
Huh? Wait, <c=#FF00FF>reading books</c> counts as disturbing the crime scene?
You’ve got to touch it to turn the pages, right? That’s not allowed.
Okay, so I guess I’ll just… blow on the pages, to flip them.
Wh- no! You can’t! That c-counts as touching them!
There’s no way that counts.
...Ugh. Yes, it does. Hands off, Seeker.
Seriously?!
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>Look, I’m not givin’ her an inch with this.</f>
<f=OpenDyslexicSmall>We follow procedure to the letter, got it?</f>
Ugh. Fine.
You can touch the book when we’ve got <c=#FF00FF>probable cause</c> to disturb the scene.
A book opened to a page detailing a ceremonial ritual.
I can’t turn the page, though, because turning the page counts as disturbing the evidence?
And Opal’s on the lookout for reasons to get Leo in trouble?
Man, the police have got a lot of red tape.
